doc.description:
Create, update or delete a Sensu Go AD authentication provider.
For more information, refer to the Sensu Go documentation at U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/operations/control-access/ad-auth/).

auth.description: Authentication parameters. Can define each of them with ENV as well.

api_key.description:
The API key that should be used when authenticating. If this is not set, the value of the SENSU_API_KEY environment variable will be checked.
This replaces I(auth.user) and I(auth.password) parameters.
For more information about the API key, refer to the official Sensu documentation at U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/guides/use-apikey-feature/).

ca_path.description:
Path to the CA bundle that should be used to validate the backend certificate.
If this parameter is not set, module will use the CA bundle that python is using.
It is also possible to set this parameter via the I(SENSU_CA_PATH) environment variable.

password.description:
The Sensu user's password. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_PASSWORD environment variable will be checked.
This parameter is ignored if the I(auth.api_key) parameter is set.

url.description: Location of the Sensu backend API. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_URL environment variable will be checked.

user.description:
The username to use for connecting to the Sensu API. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_USER environment variable will be checked.
This parameter is ignored if the I(auth.api_key) parameter is set.

verify.description:
Flag that controls the certificate validation.
If you are using self-signed certificates, you can set this parameter to C(false).
ONLY USE THIS PARAMETER IN DEVELOPMENT SCENARIOS! In you use self-signed certificates in production, see the I(auth.ca_path) parameter.
It is also possible to set this parameter via the I(SENSU_VERIFY) environment variable.

groups_prefix.description: The prefix added to all AD groups.

name.description:
The Sensu resource's name. This name (in combination with the namespace where applicable) uniquely identifies the resource that Ansible operates on.
If the resource with selected name already exists, Ansible module will update it to match the specification in the task.
Consult the I(name) metadata attribute specification in the upstream docs on U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/reference/) for more details about valid names and other restrictions.

servers.description: An array of AD servers for your directory.

binding.description:
The AD account that performs user and group lookups.
If your sever supports anonymous binding, you can omit the user_dn or password attributes to query the directory without credentials.

password.description:
Password for the user_dn account.
If your sever supports anonymous binding, you can omit this attribute.

user_dn.description:
The AD account that performs user and group lookups.
If your sever supports anonymous binding, you can omit this attribute.

client_cert_file.description: Path to the certificate that should be sent to the server if requested.

client_key_file.description:
Path to the key file associated with the client_cert_file.
Required if I(client_cert_file) is present.

default_upn_domain.description: Enables UPN authentication when set. The default UPN suffix that will be appended to the username when a domain is not specified during login (for example, user becomes user@defaultdomain.xyz).

base_dn.description: Which part of the directory tree to search.

name_attribute.description: Represents the attribute to use as the entry name.

object_class.description: Identifies the class of objects returned in the search result.

include_nested_groups.description: If true, the group search includes any nested groups a user is a member of. If false, the group search includes only the top-level groups a user is a member of.

insecure.description: Skips SSL certificate verification when set to true.

security.description: Encryption type to be used for the connection to the AD server.

trusted_ca_file.description: Path to an alternative CA bundle file.

base_dn.description: Which part of the directory tree to search.

name_attribute.description: Represents the attribute to use as the entry name.

object_class.description: Identifies the class of objects returned in the search result.

state.description: Target state of the Sensu object.

username_prefix.description: The prefix added to all AD usernames.

sensu.sensu_go.ad_auth_provider.examples:
- name: Create a AD auth provider
  sensu.sensu_go.ad_auth_provider:
    name: activedirectory
    servers:
      - host: 127.0.0.1
        group_search:
          base_dn: dc=acme,dc=org
        user_search:
          base_dn: dc=acme,dc=org
- name: Delete a AD auth provider
  sensu.sensu_go.ad_auth_provider:
    name: activedirectory
    state: absent

builds.description:
A list of asset builds used to define multiple artefacts which provide the named asset.
Required if I(state) is C(present).

filters.description: A set of Sensu query expressions used to determine if the asset should be installed.

headers.description: Additional headers to send when retrieving the asset, e.g. for authorization.

url.description: The URL location of the asset.

labels.description: Custom metadata fields that can be accessed within Sensu, as key/value pairs.

name.description:

namespace.description: RBAC namespace to operate in. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_NAMESPACE environment variable will be used.

state.description: Target state of the Sensu object.

sensu.sensu_go.asset.examples:
- name: Create a multiple-build asset
  sensu.sensu_go.asset:
    name: sensu-plugins-cpu-checks
    builds:
      - url: https://assets.bonsai.sensu.io/68546e739d96fd695655b77b35b5aabfbabeb056/sensu-plugins-cpu-checks_4.0.0_centos_linux_amd64.tar.gz
        sha512: 518e7c17cf670393045bff4af318e1d35955bfde166e9ceec2b469109252f79043ed133241c4dc96501b6636a1ec5e008ea9ce055d1609865635d4f004d7187b
        filters:
          - entity.system.os == 'linux'
          - entity.system.arch == 'amd64'
          - entity.system.platform == 'rhel'
      - url: https://assets.bonsai.sensu.io/68546e739d96fd695655b77b35b5aabfbabeb056/sensu-plugins-cpu-checks_4.0.0_alpine_linux_amd64.tar.gz
        sha512: b2da25ecd7642e6de41fde37d674fe19dcb6ee3d680e145e32289f7cfc352e6b5f9413ee9b701d61faeaa47b399aa30b25885dbc1ca432c4061c8823774c28f3
        filters:
          - entity.system.os == 'linux'
          - entity.system.arch == 'amd64'
          - entity.system.platform == 'alpine'

- name: Delete an asset
  sensu.sensu_go.asset:
    name: sensu-plugins-cpu-check
    state: absent

doc.description:
Create or update a Sensu Go asset whose definition is available in the Bonsai, the Sensu asset index.
For more information, refer to the Sensu documentation at U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/reference/assets/) and U(https://bonsai.sensu.io/).
doc.notes:
I(labels) and I(annotations) values are merged with the values obtained from Bonsai. Values passed-in as parameters take precedence over the values obtained from Bonsai.
To delete an asset, use regular M(sensu.sensu_go.asset) module.

name.description:
The Sensu resource's name. This name (in combination with the namespace where applicable) uniquely identifies the resource that Ansible operates on.
If the resource with selected name already exists, Ansible module will update it to match the specification in the task.
Consult the I(name) metadata attribute specification in the upstream docs on U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/reference/) for more details about valid names and other restrictions.

namespace.description: RBAC namespace to operate in. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_NAMESPACE environment variable will be used.

on_remote.description:
If set to C(true), module will download asset defnition on remote host.

rename.description:
The name that will be used when adding the asset to Sensu.
If not present, value of the I(name) parameter will be used.

version.description: Version number of the asset to install.

sensu.sensu_go.bonsai_asset.examples:
- name: Make sure specific version of asset is installed
  sensu.sensu_go.bonsai_asset:
    name: sensu/monitoring-plugins
    version: 2.2.0-1

- name: Remove previously added asset
  sensu.sensu_go.asset:
    name: sensu/monitoring-plugins
    state: absent

- name: Store Bonsai asset under a different name
  sensu.sensu_go.bonsai_asset:
    name: sensu/monitoring-plugins
    version: 2.2.0-1
    rename: sensu-monitoring-2.2.0-1

- name: Display asset info
  sensu.sensu_go.asset_info:
    name: sensu-monitoring-2.2.0-1  # value from rename field

doc.description:
Create, update or delete Sensu Go check.
For more information, refer to the Sensu Go documentation at U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/reference/checks/).

annotations.description:
Custom metadata fields with fewer restrictions, as key/value pairs.
These are preserved by Sensu but not accessible as tokens or identifiers, and are mainly intended for use with external tools.

auth.description: Authentication parameters. Can define each of them with ENV as well.

api_key.description:
The API key that should be used when authenticating. If this is not set, the value of the SENSU_API_KEY environment variable will be checked.
This replaces I(auth.user) and I(auth.password) parameters.
For more information about the API key, refer to the official Sensu documentation at U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/guides/use-apikey-feature/).

ca_path.description:
Path to the CA bundle that should be used to validate the backend certificate.
If this parameter is not set, module will use the CA bundle that python is using.
It is also possible to set this parameter via the I(SENSU_CA_PATH) environment variable.

password.description:
The Sensu user's password. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_PASSWORD environment variable will be checked.
This parameter is ignored if the I(auth.api_key) parameter is set.

url.description: Location of the Sensu backend API. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_URL environment variable will be checked.

user.description:
The username to use for connecting to the Sensu API. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_USER environment variable will be checked.
This parameter is ignored if the I(auth.api_key) parameter is set.

verify.description:
Flag that controls the certificate validation.
If you are using self-signed certificates, you can set this parameter to C(false).
ONLY USE THIS PARAMETER IN DEVELOPMENT SCENARIOS! In you use self-signed certificates in production, see the I(auth.ca_path) parameter.
It is also possible to set this parameter via the I(SENSU_VERIFY) environment variable.

check_hooks.description:
A mapping of response codes to hooks which will be run by the agent when that code is returned.
Note that the structure of this parameter is a bit different from the one described at U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/reference/checks/#check-hooks-attribute).
See check hooks example below for more information on exact mapping structure.

command.description:
Check command to run.
Required if I(state) is C(present).

cron.description:
Schedule check requests using crontab syntax.
Cannot be used when I(interval) option is used.

env_vars.description: A mapping of environment variable names and values to use with command execution.

handlers.description: List of handlers which receive check results.

interval.description:
Check request interval.
Cannot be used when I(cron) option is used.

labels.description: Custom metadata fields that can be accessed within Sensu, as key/value pairs.

name.description:
The Sensu resource's name. This name (in combination with the namespace where applicable) uniquely identifies the resource that Ansible operates on.
If the resource with selected name already exists, Ansible module will update it to match the specification in the task.
Consult the I(name) metadata attribute specification in the upstream docs on U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/reference/) for more details about valid names and other restrictions.

namespace.description: RBAC namespace to operate in. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_NAMESPACE environment variable will be used.

output_metric_format.description: Enable parsing of metrics in the specified format from this check's output.

output_metric_handlers.description: List of handlers which receive check results. I'm not sure why this exists.

proxy_entity_name.description: Entity name to associate this check with instead of the agent it ran on.

proxy_requests.description: Allows you to assign the check to run for multiple entities according to their entity_attributes.

entity_attributes.description: List of attribute checks for determining which proxy entities this check should be scheduled against.

splay.description: Enables or disables splaying of check request scheduling.

splay_coverage.description: Percentage of the C(interval) over which to splay checks.

publish.description: Enables or disables scheduled publication of check requests.

round_robin.description: An array of environment variables to use with command execution.

runtime_assets.description: List of runtime assets required to run the check.

secrets.description: List of secrets that are available to the command.

name.description: Variable name that will contain the sensitive data.

secret.description: Name of the secret that contains sensitive data.

state.description: Target state of the Sensu object.

stdin.description:
Enables writing of serialized JSON data to the check command's stdin.
Only usable with checks written specifically for Sensu Go.

subscriptions.description:
List of subscriptions which receive check requests.
Required if I(state) is C(present).

ttl.description: Amount of time after which a check result is considered stale.

sensu.sensu_go.check.examples:
- name: Check executing command every 30 seconds
  sensu.sensu_go.check:
    name: check
    command: check-cpu.sh -w 75 -c 90
    subscriptions:
      - checks
    interval: 30
    publish: yes

- name: Check executing command with cron scheduler
  sensu.sensu_go.check:
    name: check
    command: check-cpu.sh -w 75 -c 90
    subscriptions:
      - systems
    handlers:
      - slack
    cron: "* * * * *"
    publish: yes

- name: Ad-hoc scheduling
  sensu.sensu_go.check:
    name: check
    command: check-cpu.sh -w 75 -c 90
    subscriptions:
      - systems
    handlers:
      - slack
    interval: 60
    publish: no

- name: Report events under proxy entity name instead of agent entity
  sensu.sensu_go.check:
    name: check
    command: http_check.sh https://sensu.io
    subscriptions:
      - proxy
    handlers:
      - slack
    interval: 60
    proxy_entity_name: sensu-site
    round_robin: yes
    publish: yes

- name: Event that triggers hooks
  sensu.sensu_go.check:
    name: check
    command: http_check.sh https://sensu.io
    subscriptions: [ proxy ]
    # The upstream JSON payload for the hooks below would look like this:
    #
    #   "check_hooks": [
    #     {"0": ["passing-hook", "always-run-this-hook"]},
    #     {"critical": ["failing-hook", "always-run-this-hook"]}
    #   ]
    #
    # Ansible task simplifies this structure into a simple mapping:
    check_hooks:
      "0":
        - passing-hook
        - always-run-this-hook
      critical:
        - failing-hook
        - always-run-this-hook

- name: Remove check
  sensu.sensu_go.check:
    name: my-check
    state: absent

deregister.description: If the entity should be removed when it stops sending keepalive messages.

deregistration_handler.description: The name of the handler to be called when an entity is deregistered.

entity_class.description:
Entity class. Standard classes are C(proxy) and C(agent), but you can use whatever you want.
Required if I(state) is C(present).

labels.description: Custom metadata fields that can be accessed within Sensu, as key/value pairs.

last_seen.description: Timestamp the entity was last seen, in seconds since the Unix epoch.

name.description:
The Sensu resource's name. This name (in combination with the namespace where applicable) uniquely identifies the resource that Ansible operates on.
If the resource with selected name already exists, Ansible module will update it to match the specification in the task.

namespace.description: RBAC namespace to operate in. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_NAMESPACE environment variable will be used.

redact.description: List of items to redact from log messages. If a value is provided, it overwrites the default list of items to be redacted.

state.description: Target state of the Sensu object.

subscriptions.description: List of subscriptions for the entity.

system.description: System information about the entity, such as operating system and platform. See U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/5.13/reference/entities/#system-attributes) for more information.

user.description: Sensu RBAC username used by the entity. Agent entities require get, list, create, update, and delete permissions for events across all namespaces.

sensu.sensu_go.entity.examples:
- name: Create an entity
  sensu.sensu_go.entity:
    auth:
      url: http://localhost:8080
    name: entity
    entity_class: proxy
    subscriptions:
      - web
      - prod
    system:
      hostname: playbook-entity
      os: linux
      platform: ubutntu
      network:
        interfaces:
          - name: lo
            addresses:
              - 127.0.0.1/8
              - ::1/128
          - name: eth0
            mac: 52:54:00:20:1b:3c
            addresses:
              - 93.184.216.34/24
    last_seen: 1522798317
    deregister: yes
    deregistration_handler: email-handler
    redact:
      - password
      - pass
      - api_key
    user: agent

- name: Delete an entity
  sensu.sensu_go.entity:
    name: entity
    state: absent

ca_cert.description:
Path to an the PEM-format CA certificate to use for TLS client authentication.
Required if I(insecure) is C(false).

cert.description:
Path to the PEM-format certificate to use for TLS client authentication. This certificate is required for secure client communication.
Required if I(insecure) is C(false).

insecure.description:
Disable transport security.
Only set to C(true) in sandbox and experimental environments.

key.description:
Path to the PEM-format key file associated with the cert to use for TLS client authentication. This key and its corresponding certificate are required for secure client communication.
Required if I(insecure) is C(false).

name.description:
The Sensu resource's name. This name (in combination with the namespace where applicable) uniquely identifies the resource that Ansible operates on.
If the resource with selected name already exists, Ansible module will update it to match the specification in the task.
Consult the I(name) metadata attribute specification in the upstream docs on U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/reference/) for more details about valid names and other restrictions.

namespace.description:
Namespace to constrain replication to.
If you do not include namespace, all namespaces for a given resource are replicated.

replication_interval.description: Interval at which the resource will be replicated. In seconds.

resource.description:
Name of the resource to replicate.
List of all resources is available at U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/operations/control-access/rbac/#resources).
Required if I(state) is C(present).

state.description: Target state of the Sensu object.

url.description:
Destination cluster URLs.
Required if I(state) is C(present).

sensu.sensu_go.etcd_replicator.examples:
- name: Create a minimal replicator
  sensu.sensu_go.etcd_replicator:
    name: cluster_role_replicator
    ca_cert: /etc/sensu/certs/ca.pem
    cert: /etc/sensu/certs/cert.pem
    key: /etc/sensu/certs/key.pem
    url: https://sensu.alpha.example.com:2379
    resource: ClusterRole

- name: Create an insecure minimal replicator
  sensu.sensu_go.etcd_replicator:
    name: role_replicator
    insecure: true
    url:
      - https://sensu.beta.example.com:2379
      - https://sensu.gamma.example.com:2379
    resource: Role

- name: Create a replicator with all parameters set
  sensu.sensu_go.etcd_replicator:
    name: role_binding_replicator
    ca_cert: /etc/sensu/certs/ca.pem
    cert: /etc/sensu/certs/cert.pem
    key: /etc/sensu/certs/key.pem
    insecure: false
    url: https://127.0.0.1:2379
    api_version: core/v2
    resource: RoleBinding
    namespace: default
    replication_interval_seconds: 30

- name: Delete a replicator
  sensu.sensu_go.etcd_replicator:
    name: my_replicator
    state: absent

check.description: Name of the check associated with this event. It must exist before event creation.

check_attributes.description: Additional check parameters. Find out more at U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/reference/events/#check-attributes).

executed.description: Time that the check request was executed.

history.description: Check status history for the last 21 check executions.

issued.description: Time that the check request was issued in seconds since the Unix epoch.

last_ok.description: The last time that the check returned an OK status (0) in seconds since the Unix epoch.

output.description: The output from the execution of the check command.

state.description: The state of the check.

status.description: Exit status code produced by the check.

total_state_change.description: The total state change percentage for the check's history.

entity.description: Name of the entity associated with this event. It must exist before event creation.

metric_attributes.description: Metric attributes. Find out more at U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/reference/events/#metric-attributes).

handlers.description: An array of Sensu handlers to use for events created by the check. Each array item must be a string.

points.description: Metric data points including a name, timestamp, value, and tags.

namespace.description: RBAC namespace to operate in. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_NAMESPACE environment variable will be used.

timestamp.description: UNIX time at which the event occurred.

sensu.sensu_go.event.examples:
- name: Create an event
  sensu.sensu_go.event:
    auth:
      url: http://localhost:8080
    entity: awesome_entity
    check: awesome_check
    check_attributes:
      duration: 1.945
      executed: 1522100915
      history:
        - executed: 1552505193
          status: 1
      issued: 1552506034
      last_ok: 1552506033
      output: '10'
      state: 'passing'
      status: 'ok'
      total_state_change: 0
    metric_attributes:
      handlers:
        - handler1
        - handler2
      points:
        - name: "sensu-go-sandbox.curl_timings.time_total"
          tags:
            - name: "response_time_in_ms"
              value: 101
          timestamp: 1552506033
          value: 0.005
        - name: "sensu-go-sandbox.curl_timings.time_namelookup"
          tags:
            - name: "namelookup_time_in_ms"
              value: 57
          timestamp: 1552506033
          value: 0.004

sensu.sensu_go.filter.examples:
- name: Create a filter
  sensu.sensu_go.filter:
    name: filter
    action: deny
    expressions:
      - event.check.interval == 10
      - event.check.occurrences == 1
    runtime_assets: awesomeness

- name: Create a production filter
  sensu.sensu_go.filter:
    name: filter
    action: allow
    expressions:
      - event.entity.labels['environment'] == 'production'

- name: Create a filter with JS expression
  sensu.sensu_go.filter:
    name: filter
    action: deny
    expressions:
      - "_.reduce(event.check.history, function(memo, h) { return (memo || h.status != 0); })"
    runtime_assets:
      - underscore

- name: Handling repeated events
  sensu.sensu_go.filter:
    name: filter_interval_60_hourly
    action: allow
    expressions:
      - event.check.interval == 60
      - event.check.occurrences == 1 || event.check.occurrences % 60 == 0

- name: Delete a filter
  sensu.sensu_go.filter:
    name: filter_interval_60_hourly
    state: absent

For more information, refer to the Sensu documentation at U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/reference/hooks/).

auth.description: Authentication parameters. Can define each of them with ENV as well.

api_key.description:
The API key that should be used when authenticating. If this is not set, the value of the SENSU_API_KEY environment variable will be checked.
This replaces I(auth.user) and I(auth.password) parameters.
For more information about the API key, refer to the official Sensu documentation at U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/guides/use-apikey-feature/).

ca_path.description:
Path to the CA bundle that should be used to validate the backend certificate.
If this parameter is not set, module will use the CA bundle that python is using.
It is also possible to set this parameter via the I(SENSU_CA_PATH) environment variable.

password.description:
The Sensu user's password. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_PASSWORD environment variable will be checked.
This parameter is ignored if the I(auth.api_key) parameter is set.

url.description: Location of the Sensu backend API. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_URL environment variable will be checked.

user.description:
The username to use for connecting to the Sensu API. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_USER environment variable will be checked.
This parameter is ignored if the I(auth.api_key) parameter is set.

verify.description:
Flag that controls the certificate validation.
If you are using self-signed certificates, you can set this parameter to C(false).
ONLY USE THIS PARAMETER IN DEVELOPMENT SCENARIOS! In you use self-signed certificates in production, see the I(auth.ca_path) parameter.
It is also possible to set this parameter via the I(SENSU_VERIFY) environment variable.

name.description: Retrieve information about this specific object instead of listing all objects.

namespace.description: RBAC namespace to operate in. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_NAMESPACE environment variable will be used.

sensu.sensu_go.hook_info.examples:
- name: List all Sensu hooks
  sensu.sensu_go.hook_info:
  register: result

- name: Fetch a specific Sensu hook
  sensu.sensu_go.hook_info:
    name: awesome-hook
  register: result

auth.description: Authentication parameters. Can define each of them with ENV as well.

verify.description:

If you are using self-signed certificates, you can set this parameter to C(false).
ONLY USE THIS PARAMETER IN DEVELOPMENT SCENARIOS! In you use self-signed certificates in production, see the I(auth.ca_path) parameter.
It is also possible to set this parameter via the I(SENSU_VERIFY) environment variable.

groups_prefix.description: The prefix added to all LDAP groups.

name.description:
The Sensu resource's name. This name (in combination with the namespace where applicable) uniquely identifies the resource that Ansible operates on.
If the resource with selected name already exists, Ansible module will update it to match the specification in the task.
Consult the I(name) metadata attribute specification in the upstream docs on U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/reference/) for more details about valid names and other restrictions.

servers.description:
An array of LDAP servers for your directory.
Required if I(state) is C(present).

binding.description:
The LDAP account that performs user and group lookups.
If your sever supports anonymous binding, you can omit the user_dn or password attributes to query the directory without credentials.

password.description:
Password for the user_dn account.
If your sever supports anonymous binding, you can omit this attribute.

user_dn.description:
The LDAP account that performs user and group lookups.
If your sever supports anonymous binding, you can omit this attribute.

client_cert_file.description: Path to the certificate that should be sent to the server if requested.

client_key_file.description:
Path to the key file associated with the client_cert_file.
Required if I(client_cert_file) is present.

base_dn.description: Which part of the directory tree to search.

name_attribute.description: Represents the attribute to use as the entry name.

object_class.description: Identifies the class of objects returned in the search result.

insecure.description: Skips SSL certificate verification when set to true.

security.description: Encryption type to be used for the connection to the LDAP server.

trusted_ca_file.description: Path to an alternative CA bundle file.

base_dn.description: Which part of the directory tree to search.

name_attribute.description: Represents the attribute to use as the entry name.

object_class.description: Identifies the class of objects returned in the search result.

state.description: Target state of the Sensu object.

username_prefix.description: The prefix added to all LDAP usernames.

sensu.sensu_go.ldap_auth_provider.examples:
- name: Create a LDAP auth provider
  sensu.sensu_go.ldap_auth_provider:
    name: openldap
    servers:
      - host: 127.0.0.1
        group_search:
          base_dn: dc=acme,dc=org
        user_search:
          base_dn: dc=acme,dc=org

- name: Delete a LDAP auth provider
  sensu.sensu_go.ldap_auth_provider:
    name: openldap
    state: absent

auth.description: Authentication parameters. Can define each of them with ENV as well.

It is also possible to set this parameter via the I(SENSU_CA_PATH) environment variable.

password.description:

url.description: Location of the Sensu backend API. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_URL environment variable will be checked.

verify.description:
Flag that controls the certificate validation.

It is also possible to set this parameter via the I(SENSU_VERIFY) environment variable.

command.description:
The mutator command to be executed by the Sensu backend.
Required if I(state) is C(present).

env_vars.description: A mapping of environment variable names and values to use with command execution.

labels.description: Custom metadata fields that can be accessed within Sensu, as key/value pairs.

name.description:
The Sensu resource's name. This name (in combination with the namespace where applicable) uniquely identifies the resource that Ansible operates on.
If the resource with selected name already exists, Ansible module will update it to match the specification in the task.
Consult the I(name) metadata attribute specification in the upstream docs on U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/reference/) for more details about valid names and other restrictions.

namespace.description: RBAC namespace to operate in. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_NAMESPACE environment variable will be used.

runtime_assets.description: List of runtime assets, required to run the mutator I(command).

secrets.description: List of secrets that are available to the command.

name.description: Variable name that will contain the sensitive data.

secret.description: Name of the secret that contains sensitive data.

state.description: Target state of the Sensu object.

timeout.description: The mutator execution duration timeout in seconds (hard stop).

sensu.sensu_go.mutator.examples:
- name: Create a mutator
  sensu.sensu_go.mutator:
    name: mutator
    command: sensu-influxdb-mutator
    timeout: 30
    env_vars:
      INFLUXDB_ADDR: http://influxdb.default.svc.cluster.local:8086
      INFLUXDB_USER: sensu
    runtime_assets:
      - sensu-influxdb-mutator

- name: Delete a mutator
  sensu.sensu_go.mutator:
    name: mutator
    state: absent

additional_scopes.description: Scopes to include in the claims.

auth.description: Authentication parameters. Can define each of them with ENV as well.

Flag that controls the certificate validation.

ONLY USE THIS PARAMETER IN DEVELOPMENT SCENARIOS! In you use self-signed certificates in production, see the I(auth.ca_path) parameter.
It is also possible to set this parameter via the I(SENSU_VERIFY) environment variable.

client_id.description:
The OIDC provider application Client ID.
Required if I(state) is C(present).

client_secret.description:
The OIDC provider application Client Secret.
Required if I(state) is C(present).

disable_offline_access.description: If C(true), the OIDC provider cannot include the offline_access scope in the authentication request. Otherwise, C(false).

groups_claim.description: The claim to use to form the associated RBAC groups.

groups_prefix.description: The prefix added to all OIDC groups.

name.description:
The Sensu resource's name. This name (in combination with the namespace where applicable) uniquely identifies the resource that Ansible operates on.
If the resource with selected name already exists, Ansible module will update it to match the specification in the task.
Consult the I(name) metadata attribute specification in the upstream docs on U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/reference/) for more details about valid names and other restrictions.

redirect_uri.description: Redirect URL to provide to the OIDC provider.

server.description:
The location of the OIDC server you wish to authenticate against.
Required if I(state) is C(present).

state.description: Target state of the Sensu object.

username_claim.description:
The claim to use to form the final RBAC user name.
Required if I(state) is C(present).

username_prefix.description: The prefix added to all OIDC usernames.

sensu.sensu_go.oidc_auth_provider.examples:
- name: Create a OIDC auth provider
  sensu.sensu_go.oidc_auth_provider:
    state: present
    name: oidc_name
    additional_scopes:
        - groups
        - email
    client_id: a8e43af034e7f2608780
    client_secret: b63968394be6ed2edb61c93847ee792f31bf6216
    disable_offline_access: false
    redirect_uri: http://127.0.0.1:8080/api/enterprise/authentication/v2/oidc/callback
    server: https://oidc.example.com:9031
    groups_claim: groups
    groups_prefix: 'oidc:'
    username_claim: email
    username_prefix: 'oidc:'

- name: Delete a OIDC auth provider
  sensu.sensu_go.oidc_auth_provider:
    name: oidc_name
    state: absent

sensu.sensu_go.pipe_handler.examples:
- name: Setup InfluxDB handler

    name: influx-db
    command: sensu-influxdb-handler -d sensu
    env_vars:
      INFLUXDB_ADDR: http://influxdb.default.svc.cluster.local:8086
      INFLUXDB_USER: sensu
      INFLUXDB_PASS: password
    runtime_assets:
      - sensu-influxdb-handler

- name: Delete  handler
  sensu.sensu_go.pipe_handler:
    name: influx-db
    state: absent

doc.description:
Create, update or delete Sensu role binding.
For more information, refer to the Sensu documentation at U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/reference/rbac/#role-bindings-and-cluster-role-bindings).

auth.description: Authentication parameters. Can define each of them with ENV as well.

api_key.description:
The API key that should be used when authenticating. If this is not set, the value of the SENSU_API_KEY environment variable will be checked.
This replaces I(auth.user) and I(auth.password) parameters.
For more information about the API key, refer to the official Sensu documentation at U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/guides/use-apikey-feature/).

ca_path.description:
Path to the CA bundle that should be used to validate the backend certificate.
If this parameter is not set, module will use the CA bundle that python is using.
It is also possible to set this parameter via the I(SENSU_CA_PATH) environment variable.

password.description:
The Sensu user's password. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_PASSWORD environment variable will be checked.
This parameter is ignored if the I(auth.api_key) parameter is set.

url.description: Location of the Sensu backend API. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_URL environment variable will be checked.

user.description:
The username to use for connecting to the Sensu API. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_USER environment variable will be checked.
This parameter is ignored if the I(auth.api_key) parameter is set.

verify.description:
Flag that controls the certificate validation.
If you are using self-signed certificates, you can set this parameter to C(false).
ONLY USE THIS PARAMETER IN DEVELOPMENT SCENARIOS! In you use self-signed certificates in production, see the I(auth.ca_path) parameter.
It is also possible to set this parameter via the I(SENSU_VERIFY) environment variable.

cluster_role.description:
Name of the cluster role. Note that the resulting role binding grants the cluster role to the provided users and groups in the context of I(auth.namespace) only.
This parameter is mutually exclusive with I(role).

groups.description:
List of groups to bind to the role or cluster role.
Note that at least one of I(users) and I(groups) must be specified when creating a role binding.

name.description:
The Sensu resource's name. This name (in combination with the namespace where applicable) uniquely identifies the resource that Ansible operates on.
If the resource with selected name already exists, Ansible module will update it to match the specification in the task.
Consult the I(name) metadata attribute specification in the upstream docs on U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/reference/) for more details about valid names and other restrictions.

namespace.description: RBAC namespace to operate in. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_NAMESPACE environment variable will be used.

role.description:
Name of the role.
This parameter is mutually exclusive with I(cluster_role).

state.description: Target state of the Sensu object.

users.description:
List of users to bind to the role or cluster role.
Note that at least one of I(users) and I(groups) must be specified when creating a role binding.

sensu.sensu_go.role_binding.examples:
- name: Create a role binding
  sensu.sensu_go.role_binding:
    name: dev_and_testing
    role: testers_permissive
    groups:
      - testers
      - dev
      - ops
    users:
      - alice

- name: Create a role binding for admins
  sensu.sensu_go.role_binding:
    name: org-admins
    cluster_role: admin
    groups:
      - team1-admins
      - team2-admins

- name: Delete a role binding
  sensu.sensu_go.role_binding:
    name: org-admins
    state: absent

id.description:

sensu.sensu_go.secret.examples:

    provider: env

  sensu.sensu_go.secret:
    name: hashi_valut_secret
    provider: vault
    id: secret/store#name

- name: Delete a secret
  sensu.sensu_go.secret:
    name: my_secret
    state: absent

address.description:
Address of the Vault server.
Required if I(state) is C(present).

auth.description: Authentication parameters. Can define each of them with ENV as well.

api_key.description:

verify.description:
Flag that controls the certificate validation.
If you are using self-signed certificates, you can set this parameter to C(false).
ONLY USE THIS PARAMETER IN DEVELOPMENT SCENARIOS! In you use self-signed certificates in production, see the I(auth.ca_path) parameter.
It is also possible to set this parameter via the I(SENSU_VERIFY) environment variable.

burst_limit.description: Maximum allowed number of secrets requests in a rate interval.

max_retries.description: Maximum number of times to retry failed connections to Vault server.

name.description:
The Sensu resource's name. This name (in combination with the namespace where applicable) uniquely identifies the resource that Ansible operates on.
If the resource with selected name already exists, Ansible module will update it to match the specification in the task.
Consult the I(name) metadata attribute specification in the upstream docs on U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/reference/) for more details about valid names and other restrictions.

rate_limit.description: Maximum number of secrets requests for per second.

state.description: Target state of the Sensu object.

timeout.description: Timeout (in seconds) for connection to Vault server.

tls.description: TLS configuration for establishing connection with Vault server.

ca_cert.description: Path to the certificate file of the trusted certificate authority.

client_cert.description: Path to the client certificate file.

client_key.description: Path to the client key file.

token.description:
Authentication token to use with Vault.
Required if I(state) is C(present).

version.description:
Version of the Vault key/value store.
Please refer to U(https://www.vaultproject.io/docs/secrets/kv) for additional information.

sensu.sensu_go.secrets_provider_vault.examples:
- name: Create a vault secrets provider
  sensu.sensu_go.secrets_provider_vault:
    name: my-vault
    address: https://my-vault.com
    token: VAULT_TOKEN
    version: v1

- name: Delete a vault secrets provider
  sensu.sensu_go.secrets_provider_vault:
    name: my-vault
    state: absent

doc.description:
Create, update or delete Sensu silence.
For more information, refer to the Sensu documentation at U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/reference/silencing/).

annotations.description:
Custom metadata fields with fewer restrictions, as key/value pairs.
These are preserved by Sensu but not accessible as tokens or identifiers, and are mainly intended for use with external tools.

auth.description: Authentication parameters. Can define each of them with ENV as well.

api_key.description:
The API key that should be used when authenticating. If this is not set, the value of the SENSU_API_KEY environment variable will be checked.
This replaces I(auth.user) and I(auth.password) parameters.
For more information about the API key, refer to the official Sensu documentation at U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/guides/use-apikey-feature/).

ca_path.description:
Path to the CA bundle that should be used to validate the backend certificate.
If this parameter is not set, module will use the CA bundle that python is using.
It is also possible to set this parameter via the I(SENSU_CA_PATH) environment variable.

password.description:
The Sensu user's password. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_PASSWORD environment variable will be checked.
This parameter is ignored if the I(auth.api_key) parameter is set.

url.description: Location of the Sensu backend API. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_URL environment variable will be checked.

user.description:
The username to use for connecting to the Sensu API. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_USER environment variable will be checked.
This parameter is ignored if the I(auth.api_key) parameter is set.

verify.description:
Flag that controls the certificate validation.
If you are using self-signed certificates, you can set this parameter to C(false).
ONLY USE THIS PARAMETER IN DEVELOPMENT SCENARIOS! In you use self-signed certificates in production, see the I(auth.ca_path) parameter.
It is also possible to set this parameter via the I(SENSU_VERIFY) environment variable.

begin.description: UNIX time at which silence entry goes into effect.

check.description:
The name of the check the entry should match.
If left empty a silencing entry will contain an asterisk in the check position. This indicates that any event where the originating entities subscriptions match the subscription specified in the entry will be marked as silenced, regardless of the check name.
This parameter is required if the I(subscription) parameter is absent.

expire.description: Number of seconds until the silence expires.

expire_on_resolve.description: If the entry should be deleted when a check begins return OK status (resolves).

labels.description: Custom metadata fields that can be accessed within Sensu, as key/value pairs.

namespace.description: RBAC namespace to operate in. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_NAMESPACE environment variable will be used.

state.description: Target state of the Sensu object.

subscription.description:
The name of the subscription the entry should match.
If left empty a silencing entry will contain an asterisk in the subscription position. This indicates that any event with a matching check name will be marked as silenced, regardless of the originating entities subscriptions.
Specific entity can also be targeted by taking advantage of per-entity subscription (entity:<entity_name>).
This parameter is required if the I(check) parameter is absent.

sensu.sensu_go.silence.examples:
- name: Silence a specific check
  sensu.sensu_go.silence:
    subscription: proxy
    check: check-disk

- name: Silence specific check regardless of the originating entities subscription
  sensu.sensu_go.silence:
    check: check-cpu

- name: Silence all checks on a specific entity
  sensu.sensu_go.silence:
    subscription: entity:important-entity
    expire: 120
    reason: rebooting the world

- name: Delete a silencing entry
  sensu.sensu_go.silence:
    subscription: entity:important-entity
    state: absent

doc.description:
Create, update or delete Sensu socket handler.
For more information, refer to the Sensu documentation at U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/reference/handlers/#tcp-udp-handlers).

annotations.description:
Custom metadata fields with fewer restrictions, as key/value pairs.
These are preserved by Sensu but not accessible as tokens or identifiers, and are mainly intended for use with external tools.

auth.description: Authentication parameters. Can define each of them with ENV as well.

api_key.description:
The API key that should be used when authenticating. If this is not set, the value of the SENSU_API_KEY environment variable will be checked.
This replaces I(auth.user) and I(auth.password) parameters.
For more information about the API key, refer to the official Sensu documentation at U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/guides/use-apikey-feature/).

ca_path.description:
Path to the CA bundle that should be used to validate the backend certificate.
If this parameter is not set, module will use the CA bundle that python is using.
It is also possible to set this parameter via the I(SENSU_CA_PATH) environment variable.

password.description:
The Sensu user's password. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_PASSWORD environment variable will be checked.
This parameter is ignored if the I(auth.api_key) parameter is set.

url.description: Location of the Sensu backend API. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_URL environment variable will be checked.

user.description:
The username to use for connecting to the Sensu API. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_USER environment variable will be checked.
This parameter is ignored if the I(auth.api_key) parameter is set.

verify.description:
Flag that controls the certificate validation.
If you are using self-signed certificates, you can set this parameter to C(false).
ONLY USE THIS PARAMETER IN DEVELOPMENT SCENARIOS! In you use self-signed certificates in production, see the I(auth.ca_path) parameter.
It is also possible to set this parameter via the I(SENSU_VERIFY) environment variable.

filters.description: List of filters to use when determining whether to pass the check result to this handler.

host.description:
The socket host address (IP or hostname) to connect to.
Required if I(state) is C(present).

labels.description: Custom metadata fields that can be accessed within Sensu, as key/value pairs.

mutator.description: Mutator to call for transforming the check result before passing it to this handler.

name.description:
The Sensu resource's name. This name (in combination with the namespace where applicable) uniquely identifies the resource that Ansible operates on.
If the resource with selected name already exists, Ansible module will update it to match the specification in the task.
Consult the I(name) metadata attribute specification in the upstream docs on U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/reference/) for more details about valid names and other restrictions.

namespace.description: RBAC namespace to operate in. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_NAMESPACE environment variable will be used.

port.description:
The socket port to connect to.
Required if I(state) is C(present).

state.description: Target state of the Sensu object.

type.description:
The handler type.
Required if I(state) is C(present).

sensu.sensu_go.socket_handler.examples:
- name: TCP handler
  sensu.sensu_go.socket_handler:
    name: tcp_handler
    type: tcp
    host: 10.0.1.99
    port: 4444

- name: UDP handler
  sensu.sensu_go.socket_handler:
    name: udp_handler
    type: udp
    host: 10.0.1.99
    port: 4444

- name: Delete a handler
  sensu.sensu_go.socket_handler:
    name: udp_handler
    state: absent

doc.description:
Create, update, activate or deactivate Sensu user.
For more information, refer to the Sensu documentation at U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/reference/rbac/#users).

auth.description: Authentication parameters. Can define each of them with ENV as well.

api_key.description:
The API key that should be used when authenticating. If this is not set, the value of the SENSU_API_KEY environment variable will be checked.
This replaces I(auth.user) and I(auth.password) parameters.
For more information about the API key, refer to the official Sensu documentation at U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/guides/use-apikey-feature/).

ca_path.description:
Path to the CA bundle that should be used to validate the backend certificate.
If this parameter is not set, module will use the CA bundle that python is using.
It is also possible to set this parameter via the I(SENSU_CA_PATH) environment variable.

password.description:
The Sensu user's password. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_PASSWORD environment variable will be checked.
This parameter is ignored if the I(auth.api_key) parameter is set.

url.description: Location of the Sensu backend API. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_URL environment variable will be checked.

user.description:
The username to use for connecting to the Sensu API. If this is not set the value of the SENSU_USER environment variable will be checked.
This parameter is ignored if the I(auth.api_key) parameter is set.

verify.description:
Flag that controls the certificate validation.
If you are using self-signed certificates, you can set this parameter to C(false).
ONLY USE THIS PARAMETER IN DEVELOPMENT SCENARIOS! In you use self-signed certificates in production, see the I(auth.ca_path) parameter.
It is also possible to set this parameter via the I(SENSU_VERIFY) environment variable.

groups.description: List of groups user belongs to.

name.description:
The Sensu resource's name. This name (in combination with the namespace where applicable) uniquely identifies the resource that Ansible operates on.
If the resource with selected name already exists, Ansible module will update it to match the specification in the task.
Consult the I(name) metadata attribute specification in the upstream docs on U(https://docs.sensu.io/sensu-go/latest/reference/) for more details about valid names and other restrictions.

password.description:
Password for the user.
Required if user with a desired name does not exist yet on the backend and I(password_hash) is not set.
If both I(password) and I(password_hash) are set, I(password_hash) is ignored and calculated from the I(password) if required.

password_hash.description:
Bcrypt password hash for the user.
Use C(sensuctl user hash-password PASSWORD) to generate a hash.
Required if user with a desired name does not exist yet on the backend and I(password) is not set.
If both I(password) and I(password_hash) are set, I(password_hash) is ignored and calculated from the I(password) if required.
Sensu Go < 5.21.0 does not support creating/updating users using hashed passwords. Use I(password) parameter if you need to manage such Sensu Go installations.
At the moment, change detection does not work properly when using password hashes because the Sensu Go backend does not expose enough information via its API.

state.description:
Desired state of the user.
Users cannot actually be deleted, only deactivated.

requirements: bcrypt (when managing Sensu Go 5.21.0 or newer)

sensu.sensu_go.user.examples:
- name: Create a user
  sensu.sensu_go.user:
    auth:
      url: http://localhost:8080
    name: awesome_username
    password: hidden_password?
    groups:
      - dev
      - prod

- name: Use pre-hashed password
  sensu.sensu_go.user:
    auth:
      url: http://localhost:8080
    name: awesome_username
    password_hash: $5f$14$.brXRviMZpbaleSq9kjoUuwm67V/s4IziOLGHjEqxJbzPsreQAyNm

- name: Deactivate a user
  sensu.sensu_go.user:
    name: awesome_username
    state: disabled

name.description: Retrieve information about this specific object instead of listing all objects.

sensu.sensu_go.user_info.examples:
- name: List Sensu users
  sensu.sensu_go.user_info:
  register: result

- name: Retrieve a single Sensu user
  sensu.sensu_go.user_info:
    name: my-user
  register: result
